message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR 

This paper is about deep learning based text classification, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The paper specifically focuses on meta-learning for few-shot text classification, which involves learning from a small amount of labeled data. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which is dedicated to NLP research. The paper also discusses the use of attention mechanisms, which are commonly used in NLP tasks, and therefore cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves the use of deep learning models, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed method on datasets commonly used in information retrieval (IR) research, which suggests cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as a possible sub-category.
